page.title: 16A DAY OUT TO CHATHAM, 1985
page.content: There is no carpet and some compartments can be rather dirty at times. Compartments are usually ones where one can smoke, although there are some for non-smokers. There are also some windows and those above the door open. In Chatham we go to most of the clothes and shoe shops, buying various things which we can afford. At around 1.00 pm, we start to feel hungry, and each time we go to a different place to have our lunch. We sometimes go to Tesco's restaurant which is reaonably cheap. Around 1 pound 20 for a real orange drink plus a warm dinner, chips, beans and beefburger. Not long after settling down comfortably, it is time to go. We usually go back home on the train at 3.00 pm. By Teresa Kujawska Chapter School
